title: Man Utd urged not to sign James Maddison by former Red Devils star
text:

Former Man Utd flop Kleberson has urged his old club not to sign James Maddison after questioning whether he is good enough.

The Leicester and England midfielder has drawn plaudits for his performances this season after helping the Foxes to fourth in the table.

United have been linked with a £60m move for the 22-year-old, while Liverpool are also mooted to be interested.

But Brazilian Kleberson - who himself struggled during his time at United - feels it would be a bad move for the Red Devils.

"I don’t think it would be great for Maddison to join United," Kleberson told US Bookies .

(Image: Getty Images)

"They [Leicester] have had a good start to the season but when you do a big jump from a smaller club to United, it is mentally tough for these players.

"They have to be able to learn to adapt to play at a big club. It will be interesting to see if they can, but I don’t know if he will be a good enough signing for United."

Maddison has so far provided two goals and two assists in seven Premier League appearances this season for Leicester.

He was called into the latest England squad by Gareth Southgate, but had to withdraw due to illness before being spotted in a casino on the night of the Three Lions' match with Czech Republic.

(Image: Leicester City FC via Getty Imag)

The former Norwich man is just one of a number of stars United are believed to be targeting, including Juventus striker Mario Mandzukic and Napoli defender Khalidou Koulibaly.

And Kleberson feels these players are more of the calibre that United should be looking to attract.

"When you sign big players like Mandzukic, you can see the impact they bring into the club, not just on the pitch but also off the pitch," he added.

(Image: Getty Images)

"They bring experience for the young players which helps to improve them as they grow into their careers.

"Koulibaly looks athletic and physical which will bring more energy in the defence.

"[Harry] Maguire is a big name in England, but it would be good for United to look outside of the Premier League to find players who could play for them."
description: The Leicester and England midfielder has been heavily linked with a move to Old Trafford after good form this season
